title: Practice-Based Learning Design for Strengthening Clinical Pharmacy Practical Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: A program for pre-service/in-service teachers to strengthen clinical pharmaceutical practice skills linked to mathematics curricula, conducted via smartphones in technology-constrained environments

learning_goals: Learners can establish pharmaceutical intervention plans based on patient conditions by analyzing at least three virtual clinical cases weekly over eight weeks.
Learners can achieve over 80% proficiency in ten core clinical skills (e.g., drug interaction assessment, prescription review) using simulation tools provided via LMS.
Learners can demonstrate clinical judgment skills at or above the "Competent" stage of the Dreyfus model in the final evaluation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
